This article needs a plot summary. Please add one in your own words. (August 2023) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Film by Danny A. Abeckaser

Inside Man is a 2023 American independent crime thriller film directed by Danny A. Abeckaser and written by Kosta Kondilopoulos. It stars Emile Hirsch, Jake Cannavale, Lucy Hale, Ashley Greene, Abeckaser, Vincent Laresca, Kyle Stefanski, James Russo and Robert Davi.


Cast[edit]
Emile Hirsch as Bobby Belucci
Greg Finley as Anthony Senter
Lucy Hale as Gina
Ashley Greene as Mary Belucci
Danny A. Abeckaser as Roy DeMeo
Vincent Laresca as James Curtis [1]
Jake Cannavale as Chris Rosenberg
Robert Davi[1] as Anthony 'Nino' Gaggi
Bo Dietl[1] as Captain Rick Callan
Sid Rosenberg as Joseph "Dracula" Guglielmo[1]
Jeremy Luke as Louis Russo [1]
James Russo as Garo Balikian [1]
Kyle Stefanski as Freddie DiNome
George Andreakos as Luca Santi
Darren Weiss as Mick
Production[edit]
In March 2022, it was announced that Emile Hirsch, Lucy Hale, Ashley Greene and Greg Finley would star in the film.[2][1]
Principal photography began in March 2022 in Los Angeles and New York.[1][3]

Release[edit]
In February 2023, Vertical Entertainment purchased the North American rights to the film, then titled The Gemini Lounge, after the name of a bar in Brooklyn, which was frequented by the mob.[4]
The film was released in theaters and on demand on August 11, 2023.[5]

^ Grobar, Matt (March 2, 2022). "Emile Hirsch To Star In Crime Thriller 'Gemini Lounge' From 'Rush Hour' Producer Arthur Sarkissian". Deadline Hollywood. Retrieved April 24, 2022.

^ Yossman, K.J. (March 17, 2022). "Greg Finley Joins Crime Thriller 'Gemini Lounge' From 'Rush Hour' Producer Arthur Sarkissian (Exclusive)". Variety. Retrieved April 24, 2022.

^ Lang, Brent (February 7, 2023). "Vertical Buys The Gemini Lounge, Mob Thriller With Emile Hirsch, Ashley Greene, Lucy Hale (Exclusive)". Variety. Retrieved February 7, 2023.

^ Devore, Britta (July 6, 2023). "Emile Hirsch and Lucy Hale Take on the Mob in 'Inside Man' Trailer". Collider. Retrieved July 6, 2023.
